definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
powder/cosmetic face powder/food prepared from starch/noodles or pasta made from any kind of flour/whitewash/white/pink

sentences.english: For example, plants could bloom earlier than their pollinating insects become active.
sentences.chinese: 例如，植物可以開花早於他們的傳粉昆蟲活躍。

sentences.english: The cross-pollinating representatives are totally different.
sentences.chinese: 其異花傳粉的代表是完全不同的。

sentences.english: They damage female strobili during the interval between pollination and fertilization.
sentences.chinese: 在傳粉與受精的間隔期間，他們毀壞了雌球花。

sentences.english: Pollinators are often visually attracted by the shape and colours of the labellum .
sentences.chinese: 傳粉昆蟲通常被脣瓣的形狀和顏色的視覺效果所吸引。

sentences.english: They were all around because of the diverse landscapes.
sentences.chinese: 因爲自然景觀多變，到處都能找到傳粉動物。

sentences.english: Open-pollinated progenies of such genotypes are raised separately.
sentences.chinese: 將這種基因型的自由傳粉的後代分別播種。
大黃蜂是它們的主要傳粉者。

sentences.english: The difference should be discernible in the time of flowering and pollination in orchards.
sentences.chinese: 在種子園的開花和傳粉時，可以看出這一差異。

sentences.english: And wind-pollinated plants tend to produce huge quantities of pollen.
sentences.chinese: 風媒傳粉的植物常常製作大量的花粉。

sentences.english: Cross-pollination is favored by a separation of fertile organs in the flower.
sentences.chinese: 可育花器官分離的花偏愛異花傳粉。

sentences.english: T. sinensis is a wind- and insect-pollinated species.
sentences.chinese: 具有適應風媒和蟲媒傳粉的花部特徵。

sentences.english: Incarvillea lutea is self-compatible, but depends on insects for seed production.
sentences.chinese: 黃波羅花自交親和，但必須依賴昆蟲傳粉產生種子。

sentences.english: There are same examples of plant-pollinating insect coevolution.
sentences.chinese: 有些植物和傳粉昆蟲間出現了協同進化。
